frontmatter.description: A high incidence of dyslexic traits are found in computer programmers. These special traits and abilities are commonly depicted as disabilities. In the same vein, one-fifth of the estimated global population possesses disabilities. Join me as we deploy the narratives that exist at the intersection of ability and access. Letâ€™s steer the strengths, park the misconceptions, and drive hacks meant to empower programmers who exhibit special traits and abilities.
frontmatter.title: What's Dyslexia Got To Do With It
frontmatter.subtitle: Jeannette Washington
